abstract: Apple has taken technologies like the multitouch user interface from the iPhone and the iPad and put them in its new MacBook Air laptops and operating system.
snippet: Apple has taken technologies like the multitouch user interface from the iPhone and the iPad and put them in its new MacBook Air laptops and operating system.
lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif.  Over the last few years, Apple used technologies from its Macintosh computers to create the iPhone and the iPad, building a multibillion-dollar mobile computing business that now accounts for 60 percent of its revenue.

headline.main: Apple Flips the Playbook, Putting Mobile Tech in PCs
headline.print_headline: Apple Flips the Playbook, Putting Mobile Tech in PCs
